description: From Middle English fortaken, equivalent to for- +‎ take. Cognate with dialectal Norwegian fortaka (“to assail, assault”), Swedish förta (“to deprive, take away, deaden”).

verbs.description: fortake (third-person singular simple present fortakes, present participle fortaking, simple past fortook, past participle fortaken)

entries.meaning: (transitive, UK dialectal) To mistake; make a mistake.
(transitive, UK dialectal) To aim or deal a blow at; hit.
